attributes.action: MPs to be fined a days wage if they fall asleep during debates in the chamber.
attributes.background: Photos of MPs asleep in the chamber during debates in parliament have been circulated. As a tax payer living in Britain, I find it appalling that MPs fall asleep during debates, which they are being PAID to attend- using tax payers money. MPs have to be fined and disciplined if found asleep.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions which call for actions that are the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament.

MPs are not employed by Parliament. All decisions about MPs' pay are the responsibility of the Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA), which is independent of both Parliament and the Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:

http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/
